lexUnit.name: glue.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: fasten or join with glue

sentence.text: If we glued little pictures of galaxies to the surface , we would see that they moved progressively further apart as we inflated the balloon .
KELLY Good painstakingly glued a gold bow to the front of her pink velvet jewellery box and stuck down a Christmas label .
Glue them in position with some rubber solution adhesive , ensuring that they are firmly fixed to the paper without the glue being visible .
Cut out or draw a picture of Freda and glue it on to the bookmark .
Acoustics ' fingerboards are glued on relatively late in production , in fact after the necks have been fitted to the bodies .
Then glue these on to the bookmark .
We simply glued the broken ear back in place and she carried on to a successful conclusion .
Glue a Christmassy shape or picture to the front of the hat .
Again , a bundle of drinking straws glued together provides a realistic model .
This means that it is cut up into comparatively small pieces which are then glued together again , usually in hydraulic presses with synthetic glues .
The slogan was spelled out in three-foot-high polystyrene lettering and glued onto a soft canvas backdrop .

Haphazardly placed photographs of King George and Queen Elizabeth , cut from a magazine , had been hastily glued to the wall before the landlord came to lunch -- to hide the marks of indoor revolver practice .
A new sole is then glued into place .
